Articles.Content:
Starting out on Career mode, theres an awful lot of possible missions- opening goo canisters at various altitudes, visiting biomes--

I haven't found any way to track which tasks I've hit and which I have not. Am I missing something obvious, or is this a planned feature, or must I go blind?

Cheers

Edited October 31, 2013 by thiosk

That sounds like a probably useful feature, a checklist of all the science things you can do.

But when you said "tracking" it made me think of a graph, which would also be a cool thing to do: a chart which shows number of flights, space missions, evas, landings, etc. and all the science gained per.

It is not a planned feature (as far as we know), but it is definitly a requested one!

And there are some mods for it that fill the void in the meantime.

I would suggest more a list of what you have already done.

Not so much, what you still have to do. That would be the "exploring" part.

But it would be nice to know that I have visited the Mun midlands to excess.... or in my case: That I never landed there.

I found out because a landing in the polar regions went wrong....
